New Records: Morocco won 3-0 against Tanzania in their Africa Cup of Nations opener.
Key Match Events: Romain Saïss scored in the 30th minute after Hakim Ziyech's free-kick was beaten out by Tanzania's goalkeeper.
Azzedine Ounahi played a slick one-two with the substitute Amine Adli before slotting past the goalkeeper to double Morocco's lead.
Youssef En-Nesyri tucked in the third goal after Ounahi crossed for him.
Novatus Miroshi of Tanzania was sent off for a second yellow card 20 minutes from time.
Pre-Game Insights: There were no specific pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: André Onana has returned to Cameroon training after missing their opening match against Guinea and is likely to be included in the lineup for their group game against Senegal on Friday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article mentions that the Democratic Republic of Congo squandered a number of chances in a 1-1 draw with Zambia, who took the lead thanks to a quick-thinking effort by Kings Kangwa.
Others: The article also mentions that the Africa Cup of Nations 2023 is taking place, and that Cameroon's goalkeeper André Onana has a chequered history with the team.
